availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p:
Alexandria, Virginia, General. Westmoreland County, Virginia, native. Son of Henry Lee III and Anne Lee. Married to Mary Custis Lee on June 30, 1831 in Alexandria, Virginia. Father of George Lee, Mary Lee, William Lee, Anne Lee, Eleanor Lee, Robert Lee, Mildred Lee.
Graduate of U.S. Military Academy in 1829. Served in U.S. Army as lieutenant, first lieutenant, captain, lieutenant colonel, and colonel, from 1829 to 1861. Served in C.S.A. as brigadier general, general, and general-in-chief of the army, 1861 to 1865. President of Washington College from 1865 to 1870.

ab.bibl:
William L. Barney, The Oxford Encyclopedia of the Civil War (New York: Oxford University Press, 2011), 187-188.
Find A Grave, "Robert Edward Lee (1807-1870)," Memorial #615, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/615/ (accessed April 4, 2019).
